snippet: The decision furthered President Obama’s self-described evolution on same-sex marriage rights as his administration appeared closer to confronting a state over its refusal to recognize such rights.
abstract: Justice Department announces that federal government will recognize as lawful the marriages of some 1,300 same-sex couples in Utah, despite state government's refusal to do so; move is Obama administration's latest contribution to the fast-moving legal battle over same-sex marriage rights.

byline.original: By CHARLIE SAVAGE and JACK HEALY
byline.contributor: Charlie Savage reported from Washington, and Jack Healy from Denver.

lead_paragraph: The decision furthered President Obama’s self-described evolution on same-sex marriage rights as his administration appeared closer to confronting a state over its refusal to recognize such rights.

headline.main: U.S. to Recognize 1,300 Marriages Disputed by Utah
headline.print_headline: U.S. to Recognize 1,300 Marriages Disputed by Utah

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
